See, your problem with the system is actually about the clarity of the system. 

The system works, but does a horrible job in telling people that it's working, so people ASSUME they can get away with certain stuff, cos they saw people do / say horrible stuff and think the toxics got away with it. 




So when you say the system doesn't work, it should really be corrected to add in the "feeling" that it doesn't work and feels inconsistent.  Some of it comes from the fact that the is assumed to work in one manner, but actually works in a different way, therefore misunderstood.





---

Btw, there are a bunch of smaller systems that make up the behavioral system;

* Verbal
 * Machine learning system
 * Zero tolerance system
* Gameplay
 * feeder buster (currently tuned to the mild side)
 * Manual reviews for Trolling
* Leaver buster (for afking / leaving games)
* Low priority queue (for queue dodges)
* Honors system

Those sub-systems aren't run by the same system. The systems for verbal are pretty good at what they do and provide moderate feedback. The feeder buster is ok for the obvious cases (from a coding perspective, not from a human's brain perspective) of inting, and provides low feedback. While the manual review is backlogged and doesn't provide any feedback. Leaver buster also doesn't give feedback.

How the verbal system works is commonly misunderstood, and it oftenly results in the feeling of "why wasnt that dude punished?".

Riot Tantram has mentioned that they are currently working on something even more exciting than [Monthly report cards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/aFmEtAVK-riot-should-add-monthly-status-cards). I truly hope such feature can provide the system with more clarity.

I do understand, and no I do not think you are wrong to play a game to win, but if you are going to be constantly angry at losing a team based game when you can only contribute so much towards your team's effectiveness I think your time could be better used elsewhere (probably in a pve setting), though obviously it is your choice to queue up or not (nor would I really tell people not to play just because they might get tilted, they have to make that choice for themselves).

Again it is not apathy to not take an extreme reaction to something not going your way. You can be invested in a game without freaking out every time a team mate dies, or getting angry every single time you lose. Apathy isn't a lack of negative reactions, it is a lack of interest in general. You can play a game to win, and enjoy winning. Nothing about that says you have to lash out at people when you lose.

Yes, I do understand people have natural reactions, but people can also improve themselves and work past those reactions. At no point did I say it doesn't sting to lose a game, it can feel bad when a single miss play costs you your nexus, but I do my best to keep that feeling from becoming anger, or lashing out at my team mates.

All that being said I do not appreciate the seemingly condescending tone, or the putting words in my mouth (even if they are stated as assumptions on your part).

That being said I am not going to flame him for starting a match when he knew he likely wouldn't have the time to finish it.
